jassimp

Enum AiShadingMode

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<AiShadingMode>
      • jassimp.AiShadingMode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<AiShadingMode>

    public enum AiShadingMode
extends java.lang.Enum<AiShadingMode>
    Defines all shading modes supported by the library.

    The list of shading modes has been taken from Blender. See Blender documentation for more information. The API does not distinguish between "specular" and "diffuse" shaders (thus the specular term for diffuse shading models like Oren-Nayar remains undefined).

    Again, this value is just a hint. Assimp tries to select the shader whose most common implementation matches the original rendering results of the 3D modeller which wrote a particular model as closely as possible.

      Fresnel shading.
      GOURAUD
      Simple Gouraud shading.
      MINNAERT
      Minnaert-Shading per pixel.
      NO_SHADING
      No shading at all.
      OREN_NAYAR
      OrenNayar-Shading per pixel.
      PHONG
      Phong-Shading.
      TOON
      Toon-Shading per pixel.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • FLAT

        public static final AiShadingMode FLAT
        Flat shading.

        Shading is done on per-face base, diffuse only. Also known as 'faceted shading'.

      • GOURAUD

        public static final AiShadingMode GOURAUD
        Simple Gouraud shading.

      • PHONG

        public static final AiShadingMode PHONG
        Phong-Shading.

      • BLINN

        public static final AiShadingMode BLINN
        Phong-Blinn-Shading.

      • TOON

        public static final AiShadingMode TOON
        Toon-Shading per pixel.

        Also known as 'comic' shader.

      • OREN_NAYAR

        public static final AiShadingMode OREN_NAYAR
        OrenNayar-Shading per pixel.

        Extension to standard Lambertian shading, taking the roughness of the material into account

      • MINNAERT

        public static final AiShadingMode MINNAERT
        Minnaert-Shading per pixel.

        Extension to standard Lambertian shading, taking the "darkness" of the material into account

      • COOK_TORRANCE

        public static final AiShadingMode COOK_TORRANCE
        CookTorrance-Shading per pixel.

        Special shader for metallic surfaces.

      • NO_SHADING

        public static final AiShadingMode NO_SHADING
        No shading at all.

        Constant light influence of 1.0.

      • FRESNEL

        public static final AiShadingMode FRESNEL
        Fresnel shading.
